intro: Eremophila santalina, commonly known as the silver mulla mulla, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has narrow, silver-gray leaves that help reduce water loss, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Eremophila santalina is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
